description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2lreb","text":"This protocol describes the creation of YIPF3, YIPF4, FIP200, CALCOCO1, and ATG7 knockout cell lines in HEK293 and HeLa cells using CRISPR-Cas9.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

fork_info.title: Gene editing of YIPF3, YIPF4, CALCOCO1, FIP200, and ATG7 in HEK293 and HeLa cells

materials_text:
{"blocks":[{"key":"17v0b","text":"Puromycin (Gold Biotechnology, P-600-100) 
pX459 (Addgene #62988)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cc8lo","text":"HEK293 (ATCC CRL-1573, RRID: CVCL_0045 )","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fjv9l","text":"anti-YIPF4 (Sino Biological 202844-T46)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"drlk3","text":"anti-ATG7 (Cell Signaling Technology, 8558S) 
anti-CALCOCO1 (Abclonal A7987) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2qon5","text":"Dulbecco’s MEM (DMEM), high glucose, pyruvate (Gibco / Invitrogen, 11995) 










","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"95gpt","text":"Maintain HEK293 and/or HeLa cells in Dulbecco’ Modifies Eagles Medium (DMEM) with 10% fetal bovine serum and optional 1% penicillin-streptomycin. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Targeted knock-out specific genes including YIPF3, YIPF4, CALCOCO1, FIP200, or ATG7: targeting vector creation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5egp5","text":"For YIPF4 knock-out, the following sgRNA sequences were designed and ordered (5’  ATCTCGCGGCGACTCCCAAC 3' / 5’ CGGCCTATGCCCCCACTAAC 3' ), and cloned into a pX459 vector to create pX459-gRNA-YIPF4-KO.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dg06p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3jug6","text":"For CALCOCO1 knock-out, the following sgRNA sequences were designed and ordered (5’  AAGTTGACTCCACCACGGGA 3' / 5’ CTAAGCCGGGCACCATCCCG 3'), and cloned into a pX459 vector to create pX459-gRNA-CALCOCO1-KO. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6j7c0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9i1hi","text":"For ATG7 knock-out, the following sgRNA sequence was designed and ordered (5’ ATCCAAGGCACTACTAAAAG 3'), and cloned into a pX459 vector to create pX459-gRNA-ATG7-KO. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbjpn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3lttq","text":"For FIP200 knock-out, the following sgRNA sequence was designed and ordered (5’ ACTACGATTGACACTAAAGA 3'), and cloned into a pX459 vector to create pX459-gRNA-FIP200-KO. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3d8ot","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5315c","text":"For YIPF3 knock-out, the following sgRNA sequences were designed and ordered (5’  CCATTTCGGGCGCCGCCCGC 3' / 5’ GGCGGCGCCCGAAATGGAGC 3'), and cloned into a pX459 vector to create pX459-gRNA-YIPF3-KO. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"af3ef","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqoah","text":"Sequence validate by Sanger sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6s6e1","text":"Transfect HEK293 and/or HeLa cells with the pX459-gRNA-YIPF4-KO, pX459-gRNA-CALCOCO1-KO, pX459-gRNA-ATG7-KO, gRNA-FIP200-KO, or gRNA-YIPF3-KO with Lipofectamine 3000, and select with 1.2 µg/mL of puromycin for 24-48 hours. Select monoclonal cells by limiting dilution or by cell sorting (SONY SH800S sorter) in 96 well plates. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4d2pb","text":"Individual clones were subjected to immunoblotting with anti-YIPF4 (Sino Biological 202844-T46), anti-ATG7 (Cell Signaling Technology, 8558S), anti-FIP200 (Cell Signaling Technology, 12436), anti-YIPF3 (Invitrogen PA566621), or anti-CALCOCO1 Rabbit mAb antibody (Abclonal A7987) and clones lacking the relevant protein were selected for further analysis by Sanger sequencing of the edited alleles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Gene editing of YIPF3, YIPF4, CALCOCO1, FIP200, and ATG7 in HEK293 and HeLa cells V2
